citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
According to IACUC documents, on June 12, 2023, a pig was euthanized at study endpoints using an overdose of
potassium chloride intravenous (IV) under general anesthesia. Under the approved protocol, the method of euthanasia
was through barbiturate overdose. The laboratory members immediately notified the Protocol Coordinator about the
event.
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve,
require modifications in (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and
use of animals in ongoing activities.
Corrected before the time of inspection through an IACUC approved amendment to add potassium chloride under
anesthesia as a method of euthanasia.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On June 13, 2023, during a laboratory inventory review, the facility identified that expired Euthasol, dated 10/2022, was
used on one sheep and one pig. According to laboratory records, the expired Euthasol was used for a sheep on February
23, 2023, under Protocol SH-001 and a pig on March 15, 2023, under Protocol SW-002. Both protocols were under the
same Principal Investigator (PI). A report of the incident was submitted to the IACUC.
Expired medications could lose potency and be less effective. Each research facility shall establish and maintain
programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnosis, and treat
diseases and injuries, and the availability of emergency, weekend, and holiday care.
Corrected before the time of inspection through additional oversight by Veterinary Resources (DVR), retraining of
laboratory members, and corrective action plan.

On March 8, 2023, at 11:40AM, a member of Veterinary Resources and a Technician noted that a macaque was not in its
enclosure. According to IACUC documents, the macaque was separated from its cage mate into the bottom quadrant.
The cage mate was sedated and removed from the top quadrant for a medical procedure. The floor of the top quadrant
was not secured, which allowed the macaque to move the floor and gain access to the open top quadrant. The staff were
able to safely return the macaque to its enclosure.
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma,
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.
Corrected before the time of inspecting through retraining and a corrective action plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
According to IACUC documents, on June 12, 2023, a pig was euthanized at study endpoints using an overdose of 
potassium chloride intravenous (IV) under general anesthesia. Under the approved protocol, the method of euthanasia 
was through barbiturate overdose. The laboratory members immediately notified the Protocol Coordinator about the 
event.  
 
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve, 
require modifications in (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and 
use of animals in ongoing activities. 
 
Corrected before the time of inspection through an IACUC approved amendment to add potassium chloride under 
anesthesia as a method of euthanasia. 
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
On June 13, 2023, during a laboratory inventory review, the facility identified that expired Euthasol, dated 10/2022, was 
used on one sheep and one pig. According to laboratory records, the expired Euthasol was used for a sheep on February 
23, 2023, under Protocol SH-001 and a pig on March 15, 2023, under Protocol SW-002. Both protocols were under the 
same Principal Investigator (PI). A report of the incident was submitted to the IACUC.  
 
Expired medications could lose potency and be less effective. Each research facility shall establish and maintain 
programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnosis, and treat 
diseases and injuries, and the availability of emergency, weekend, and holiday care.  
 
Corrected before the time of inspection through additional oversight by Veterinary Resources (DVR), retraining of 
laboratory members, and corrective action plan. 
2.38(f)(1)

Miscellaneous. 
On March 8, 2023, at 11:40AM, a member of Veterinary Resources and a Technician noted that a macaque was not in its 
enclosure. According to IACUC documents, the macaque was separated from its cage mate into the bottom quadrant. 
The cage mate was sedated and removed from the top quadrant for a medical procedure. The floor of the top quadrant 
was not secured, which allowed the macaque to move the floor and gain access to the open top quadrant. The staff were 
able to safely return the macaque to its enclosure.  
 
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, 
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.  
 
Corrected before the time of inspecting through retraining and a corrective action plan. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
